page.title: 01A description of our block.
page.content: The land within this block is very undulating with quite steep slopes in places. To the West lies the coast of Anglesey and the Menai Strait whilst the city of Bangor lies, to a great extent, in the valley of the river Adda. The city is divided into several distinct areas both by geography and administration. Upper Bangor lies on top of the westerly ridge whilst Maesgeirchen is hidden behind the area known as Bangor Mountain. The area is fairly bilingual (Welsh/English) and has 6 primary and 2 secondary schools 1 in each category offering education mainly through the medium of Welsh. Unemployment is high at around 15-20%. The University and hospital provide many jobs. A range of services are avaliable from lots of small shops
